article:
In statistics and diagnostic testing, the 'negative predictive value' (NPV) is
a summary statistic used to describe the performance of a diagnostic testing
procedure. It is defined as the proportion of subjects with a negative test
result who are correctly diagnosed. A high NPV for a given test means that when
the test yields a negative result, it is most likely correct in its assessment.
In the familiar context of medical testing, a high NPV means that the test only
rarely misclassifies a sick person as being healthy. Note that this says
nothing about the tendency of the test to mistakenly classify a healthy person
as being sick.
